name: slow_query_performance_in_postgresql
description: This incident type generally refers to situations where queries in a PostgreSQL database are taking longer than expected to execute. This can lead to slow application performance and a poor user experience. It may require a deep dive into the database schema and query execution plans to diagnose and optimize the slow queries. Common solutions may include indexing, rewriting the query, or tuning the database configuration.

cells.name: cell_1
cells.content:
## Slow query performance in PostgreSQL
This incident type generally refers to situations where queries in a PostgreSQL database are taking longer than expected to execute. This can lead to slow application performance and a poor user experience. It may require a deep dive into the database schema and query execution plans to diagnose and optimize the slow queries. Common solutions may include indexing, rewriting the query, or tuning the database configuration.

cells.name: cell_2
cells.content: ## Check current connections to the database

cells.name: cell_3
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `sudo -u postgres psql -c "SELECT * FROM pg_stat_activity;"`

cells.name: cell_4
cells.content: ## Check the size of the database

cells.name: cell_5
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `sudo -u postgres psql -c "SELECT pg_size_pretty(pg_database_size('${DATABASE_NAME}'));"`

cells.name: cell_6
cells.content: ## Check the size of individual tables

cells.name: cell_7
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `sudo -u postgres psql -c "SELECT pg_size_pretty(pg_total_relation_size('${TABLE_NAME}'));"`

cells.name: cell_9
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `sudo -u postgres psql -c "SELECT pid, now() - query_start AS duration, query FROM pg_stat_activity WHERE query != '${IDLE}' AND now() - query_start > INTERVAL '5 minutes' ORDER BY duration DESC;"`

cells.name: cell_10
cells.content: ## Explain a specific query to see its execution plan

cells.name: cell_11
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `sudo -u postgres psql -c "EXPLAIN ANALYZE ${QUERY};"`

cells.name: cell_12
cells.content: ## Check the slow query log to identify frequently executed slow queries

cells.name: cell_13
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `sudo grep -i "duration" /var/log/postgresql/postgresql-${VERSION}-main.log | grep -v "duration: 0." | sort -u`

cells.name: cell_14
cells.content: ## Lack of proper indexing: If a large amount of data is being queried without proper indexing, the database engine may have to perform a lot of disk I/O to find the requested data. This can slow down query execution time significantly.
